overview:
Wanxia (Vincent) Xie is Founder of Tickreel. Prior to Tickreel, Dr. Xie worked as a Senior Software Engineer in Ask.com, which is an InteractiveCorp division and the fourth leading search engine. Dr. .Xie led the development of Meta Data in QnA channel, including answer quality classification, query property classification, question/answer/query/entity clustering, knowledge/concept extraction, and NLP techniques. Dr. Xie was the major developer of Fuzzy Matching of queries, which enabled ask.com to do fuzzy matching besides exact text matching and improved the relevancy and robustness of searching in Ask.com. Dr. Xie developed and maintained language/charset identification and UTF-8 conversion library, which was one of the key components of web crawlers. He improved the accuracy from 91% to 98%. Dr. Xie developed algorithms to support large scale computation for search engines.

Prior to ask.com, Dr. Xie worked under Prof. Sham Navathe in Georgia Institute of Technology for his Ph.D. degree in computer science. His research topics focused on distributed systems, database, and mobile computing.

Mr. Xie also received MS in Computer Science from Peking University and BE in Beijing Institute of Technology.
